title: UK Space Agency offers $62 million for innovative connectivity projects
summary: The U.K. announced 50 million British pounds ($62 million) in funding Jan. 23 for projects that could boost the country’s satellite communications industry.

title: Space Development Agency renames constellation to reflect focus on U.S. warfighter
summary: The Space Development Agency is renaming its planned network of military satellites “Proliferated Warfighter Space Architecture."

title: Europe grappling with space access challenges
summary: The European Space Agency is grappling with multiple issues that could leave Europe temporarily without its own access to space by this summer.
Satellite megaconstellations could pose a threat to the spectrum that meteorologists are eager to protect from radio frequency interference.

title: Montana Students to Hear from NASA Astronaut on Space Station
summary: Students from the Boys & Girls Club of the Flathead Reservation and Lake County in Ronan, Montana, will have an opportunity this week to hear from a NASA astronaut aboard the International Space Station. The space-to-Earth call will air live at 12 p.m. EST on Wednesday, Jan. 25, on NASA Television, the NASA app, and the agency’s website.

title: It’s belt-cinching time for space startups
summary: Space startups are hunting for cost savings as the tough financial climate threatens their business plans, leading to more innovative working practices to come out on top.

title: SpaceX may perform a wet dress rehearsal of its Starship launch system today
summary: If at first you don't succeed, cryo, cryo again.

title: SpaceX’s latest Falcon Heavy launch captured from a rare perspective
summary: NASA cameras installed on the International Space Station happened to be in the right place and at the right time to capture...

title: Lockheed Martin eyes international customers for GPS augmentation systems
summary: Lockheed Martin developed a satellite-based augmentation system that leverages the L1C signal that is interoperable with both GPS and Galileo

title: NASA to cooperate on Israeli astrophysics mission
summary: The United States and Israel are finalizing an agreement that would see NASA contribute to an upcoming Israeli astrophysics mission.
